figgy.title: Link to PULFA when the source metadata identifier is a finding aid component
Build failing: orangelight event generator tests expecting bulk: false; getting bulk: true

comments.body:
Pretty sure this is a test order issue. When https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/002435aba00cdd481d73971c5140be1c2d345d87/spec/services/orangelight_reindexer_spec.rb runs the env gets set here:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/002435aba00cdd481d73971c5140be1c2d345d87/app/services/orangelight_reindexer.rb#L17

Then it's occasionally still set when the orangelight_event_generator test runs.

comments.body: I would contend that this only strengthens the arguments for removing Coveralls integration entirely for this project.

pulfalight.title: Indexes dsc[2] elements into the collection-level documents in the "physical_holdings"

comments.body:
This currently has `physical_holdings` indexing the information as a child document:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/78365186-b887cc00-758c-11ea-825e-417bedcd56d0.png)

Within the `components`, there are deeply nested documents for each of the components which link to the dsc[2] `components` containing the physical holding information:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/78365543-38ae3180-758d-11ea-94b7-f292e221ab8a.png)

With this, one could simply off a Solr query which retrieves only the `physical_holding` component child document, rather than its entire parent collection:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/78365695-727f3800-758d-11ea-9558-017a67efbb4d.png)

This needs to be improved from two standpoints:

- Containers without holding information need to be indexed also as child documents
- Components should have better information indicating whether or not it is a parent node or a leaf node in the hierarchy
I can proceed also by referencing the LUX branch work indicating the structure of the Aeon API request.

pulfalight.title: Reimplements the Collection Context interface using Vue

comments.body:
Can any of this work be repurposed for the Table of Contents work? Perhaps the caching aspects of this can be helpful in advancing the implementation of the new design.

Otherwise, this should just be closed with statements regarding the what was deprecated.
